content.webTitle: Four charged in terror training investigation

fields.headline: Four charged in terror training investigation
fields.bodyText: Four men arrested as part of an investigation into an alleged network of terror training camps in Britain are to appear in court today on terrorist offences. Musa Akmet, 47, Mustafa Abdullah, 24 and brothers Hassan Mutegombwa, 20, and Yassin Mutegombwa, 22, were arrested along with 10 others in a series of overnight raids by anti-terrorist police across London on September 1. Some of the suspects were seized at a Chinese restaurant, and officers searched an Islamic school in East Sussex as part of the operation. Mr Akmet was charged with possessing information likely to be useful to a terrorist and possessing a firearm. Mr Abdullah was charged with possessing information likely to be useful to a terrorist. Hassan Mutegombwa is accused of procuring funds for terrorism. The charge states that on July 23 he invited another person to provide money and intended that it be used, or had reasonable cause to suppose it might be used, for terrorism. Yassin Mutegombwa is accused of three counts of receiving training for terrorism. The charges state that he went to Hampshire and Berkshire for weapons training. The brothers, from Upper Norwood, south London, will appear at City of Westminster magistrates' court today. Of the other 10 men detained in the same operation, eight were still being questioned last night and two were released without charge last week.
